title: Nature-based solutions for socially and environmentally responsible new cities: The contribution of green roofs
abstract: The growing population and its concentration in cities create innumerable environmental and social problems around the world. Bringing into cities concepts like nature-based solutions (NBS) and circular economy are imperative to preserve the environment and promote populations' wellbeing. Resourceful and circular cities, nature-based, have the potential to be resilient and multifunctional, in terms of environmental and social impacts, taking into account the building multiscales and urban sites. Green roofs are one NBS that has been gaining interest. At the level of municipalities, challenges arise to promote the application of green roofs in new and existing buildings, the population and stakeholders' engagement in this commitment being necessary. This chapter intends to give an overview about the state of the art of green roofs inclusive strategies in cities and present a case study where the methodology of inclusion of green roofs in the urban planning of a city is presented.
